Description:
Roles and Responsibilities
Position Summary:
The primary role is to identify, design and develop data analytics to support audit activities performed by the Internal Audit team.
Maintain an effective system of data analytics which provide insight into risks and controls, establishes an efficient/automated means to analyze and test large volumes of data for outliers, anomalies, patterns, and trends, and helps evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of controls.
Design and implement a continuous control monitoring program.
In addition, execute internal audits according to the UPL’s Internal Audit plan.
Primary Responsibilities:
Act as project leader for audit automation project and continuous control monitoring project.
Participate in all phases of the development cycle (planning, design, development, testing, deployment and maintenance); engage in frequent interactions with users and IT staff to define the business and technical requirements; prototype, develop and test advanced data analytics techniques; train users; document analytic procedures; and report progress to management.
Manage data extraction, storage, transformation, and processing through data analytics, and generate output for visualization/analysis by the Internal Audit team.
Provide support to the Audit team on designing new dashboards and maintaining existing dashboards using Qlik Sense or related technology.
Use data analysis tools to automate audit testing and develop techniques for continuous auditing and analyzing large volumes of data.
Create repeatable data analytics to support continuous audit monitoring programs and perform continuous controls monitoring across a range of UPL’s policies and procedures.
Perform detailed reviews of transactions, data anomalies, key risk indicator reviews at pre-established frequency, assessing the root cause of potential exceptions, and supporting remediation efforts for exceptions identified.
From time to time, conduct financial, operational, and IT internal audit projects according to the UPL Internal Audit plan, performing fieldwork at worldwide UPL locations - travel = 10-20%
Interact and collaborate with Internal Audit team members in working towards departmental goals.
Required Qualifications/Skills/Experience:
Chartered Accountant (CA) with post qualification experience of minimum 5 years in internal audit field
3-5 years of relevant/recent data analysis experience in audit or risk management
1-2 years of experience in building and supporting continuous audit monitoring programs
Strong knowledge of internal controls required
Familiarity with SAP system and data visualization tools (i.e. Qliksense, Qlikview, Tableau) is required
Strong time and project management skills required
Certified Internal Auditor (CIA), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) is a plus
Advanced MS Excel skills required with MS Access skills a plus
Flexibility to work across multiple time zones
Ability to "think outside the box" and apply creative and constructive thinking to proposed recommendations for improvements to internal process, procedures and policies
Excellent communication and listening skills with the ability to interact effectively with all levels of management

Primary focus will be on developing data driven models to address project specific objectives with immediate and long-term impact. This includes gathering and scoping requirements; working with complex datasets; building statistical and econometric models; and effectively communicating findings to stakeholders. Maintaining a broad understanding of the marketplace, Ingram Micros business model, and becoming educated on particular vendors, customers, or internal divisions business models and needs will be a must.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Understand and assist in the development of reporting, analysis and visualization of business data, metrics and measures in order to allow staff to align and track against overall business strategies, goals and objectives, drive innovation, insight and decision making, with primary emphasis on visualization and analysis.
Assist with logical and physical data modeling to support business intelligence initiatives.
Support internal platform providing ad-hoc access to large or varied datasets (Data Marts), including the development of new scripts, queries or reports.
Performs statistical analysis against company data to develop models and identify trends to drive performance.
Performs data modeling to create a semantic layer for data visualizations.
Assist with implementation of data quality improvement processes and initiatives.
Represents the BI team through interaction with business users to gather reporting and analytic requirements.
Collaborates with stakeholders and subject-matter experts to establish technical vision and analyze trade-offs between usability and performance needs.
Updates job knowledge by studying state-of-the-art/industry relevant tools, techniques, and equipment; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
Performs other duties and projects as assigned.

Job Requirements:

Bachelors degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Information Systems, Computer Science OR 4-6 years of experience in a related field such as a Business Intelligence Analyst or other comparable field.
Proficient experience using Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint in a Windows operating system.
Proficient experience with Microsoft BI Stack: SSMS, SSRS, SSIS, SSAS Tabular & Multi-Dimensional or other enterprise class tools.
Working understanding of Data Warehousing and Data Warehousing enterprise class tools
Working knowledge of data visualization methodologies and tools: Tableau, QlikView, QlikSense, PowerBI, etc.
Working understanding of ETL and ETL enterprise class technologies.

Preferred Experience/Success Factors:

Thorough knowledge of data architecture and data management principles.
Deep understanding of database systems including both relational and OLAP designs.
Proven experience in business intelligence and data analytics.
Relevant experience with UI development and/or BI data visualization techniques
Working knowledge of statistical data analysis.
Working knowledge of big data concepts and tools.
Excellent priority and time management skills; Can effectively implement multiple projects.
Strong SQL and report development and optimization experience.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Willingness to partner with business professionals or groups (which may include group speaking) in order to evangelize IT efforts in our workplace
Ability to organize information in an effective manner, to showcase relationships, qualities, quantities, and priorities, in a non-trivial but accessible and impactful manner.

Description:
Roles and Responsibilities

This position is responsible for helping Cvent business leaders make better, timely, and insightful business decisions through use of data and analytics. These decisions cross all functions of the business, including sales, marketing, client services, and technology. Cvent is investing in technologies to support collection, analysis, and dissemination of critical business data. It is critical that data needs are carefully captured throughout the entire project lifecycle.
We require a data-driven and attention-to-detail individual to accelerate our data collection and reporting capabilities. Your role will be to help us create tableau dashboards for business critical KPIs. You will liaise with internal stakeholders across global offices to understand the business requirement to develop tableau dashboards & insights. You will also be responsible for O&M of existing dashboards ensuring the dashboards are being refreshed in time and troubleshoot errors. You will also need to do QA/QC and ensure FTR. Ideal candidates will distinguish themselves by providing data analysis and insights to the business.

Work with key stakeholders and executive team to understand their data and metrics needs to ensure data integrity and most valuable and effective metrics
Execute & participate in full lifecycle of an analytics/BI/Data Visualization project: starting from gathering and understanding the stakeholder needs, creating design, architecting the solution and implementation. Also executing the functional and product tests before delivering to stakeholders.
Ability to create best visualization product to represent the kind of data at hand. Be able to understand how best to represent various data forms, e.g. text, numbers, ranges, images utilizing various visualization techniques, charts e.g. box charts, histograms, word cloud, bubble chart, heat maps, tree maps, waterfall etc.
Expert at bringing data from different data sources into the visualization tool e.g. AWS, SQL, PostgreSQL, flat files, etc.
Hands-on Knowledge of other visualization tools is a plus (QlikView, Birst, MS PowerBI, Spotfire)
Desired Candidate Profile

4-8 years of relevant work experience and preferably a bachelors degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or similar field. 4+ years hands on experience of Tableau desktop & server.
Ability to weave a story with data - What is the objective behind the visualization? What does the analysis reveal? What are the different ways the data should be looked at to infer insights?
Ability to leverage technology to solve for analytics needs - Excel, Office and working knowledge of AWS, SQL and NoSQL databases.
Strong project management skills; working knowledge of tools like jira is a plus.
Exceptional analytical thinking with experience working in a global environment.
Excellent written and oral communication skills with English language.
Understanding of Sales & marketing data metrics would be added advantage.
Perks and Benefits

Description
This will be an exciting and challenging role that will enable you to work with very large data sets, expose you to cutting edge analysis techniques, work with the latest components in cloud architecture and gain experience in the usage of location data to drive businesses. As an early member you will have significant opportunities for growth within the organization. A successful applicant will be passionate about technology and developing a deep understanding of human behavior in the real world. They would also have excellent communication skills, be able to synthesize and present complex information and be a fast learner.
You will:
Learn about location-driven marketing and how companies are using location signals to drive their business
Work closely with marketing, growth strategy and sales teams based out of our offices in USA, UK, Germany
Develop re-usable tools and templates to quickly create data driven narratives
Gather requirements, design analyses, identify data sources and define measurement metrics to present insights and recommendations for ready consumption
Be responsible for managing your work pipeline and creating re-usable analysis and documentation

Experience working with large datasets
Experience with AWS analytics infrastructure (Redshift, S3, Athena, Boto3)

Our culture is highly entrepreneurial, and our success comes from our employees who voice their opinions and ideas to facilitate growth to our bottom line. We reward hard work, support career development, offer comprehensive benefits, and foster a fun and friendly work environment.

Description:
Roles and Responsibilities
Position Summary:

The primary role is to identify, design, and develop data analytics to support audit activities performed by the Internal Audit team.
Maintain an effective system of data analytics which provide insight into risks and controls, establishes an efficient/automated means to analyze and test large volumes of data for outliers, anomalies, patterns, and trends, and helps evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of controls.
Design and implement a continuous control monitoring program.
In addition, execute internal audit projects according to the UPL’s Internal Audit plan.

Primary Responsibilities:

Act as project leader for audit automation project and continuous control monitoring project.
Participate in all phases of the development cycle (planning, design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance); engage in frequent interactions with users and IT staff to define the business and technical requirements; prototype, develop and test advanced data analytics techniques; train users; document analytic procedures; and report progress to management.
Manage data extraction, storage, transformation, and processing through data analytics, and generate output for visualization/analysis by the Internal Audit team.
Provide support to the Audit team on designing new dashboards and maintaining existing dashboards using Qlik Sense or related technology.
Use data analysis tools to automate audit testing and develop techniques for continuous auditing and analyzing large volumes of data.
Create repeatable data analytics to support continuous audit monitoring programs and perform continuous controls monitoring across a range of UPL’s policies and procedures.
Perform detailed reviews of transactions, data anomalies, key risk indicator reviews at a pre-established frequency, assessing the root cause of potential exceptions, and supporting remediation efforts for exceptions identified.
From time to time, conduct financial, operational, and IT internal audit projects according to the UPL Internal Audit plan, performing fieldwork at worldwide UPL locations - travel = 10-20%
Interact and collaborate with Internal Audit team members in working towards departmental goals.

Required Qualifications/ Skills/Experience:

Chartered Accountant (CA) with post qualification experience of minimum 5 years in internal audit field
3-5 years of relevant/recent data analysis experience in audit or risk management
1-2 years of experience in building and supporting continuous audit monitoring programs
Strong knowledge of internal controls required
Familiarity with SAP system and data visualization tools (i.e. Qliksense, Qlikview, Tableau) is required
Strong time and project management skills required
Certified Internal Auditor (CIA), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) is a plus
Advanced MS Excel skills required with MS Access skills a plus
Flexibility to work across multiple time zones
Ability to "think outside the box" and apply creative and constructive thinking to proposed recommendations for improvements to internal process, procedures and policies
Excellent communication and listening skills with the ability to interact effectively with all levels of management.

Job Description:

CrossLink is a Mumbai based analytics firm that is refashioning the way data is used in organizations.

CrossLink is a profitable, fast growing organization helping mid to large level enterprises increase ROI

on their data infrastructure. Working at CrossLink: CrossLink was founded in July, 2013 and is backed by a group of high spirited entrepreneurs. Our

team is young, passionate and excited about building data products that will change the industry. As

an early member of the CrossLink team you will get to work directly with the founders and you will

work in a fun and fast paced environment every day.

We are looking for a smart, forward thinking person with 2-4 years experience in the industry. (S)He

is expected to participate in developing cutting edge data products and interface with some of the

top clients in India to identify and solve their toughest problems.

A dynamic environment allows young employees to shoulder broad responsibilities and define their

career growth path. Primary Responsibilities:

- Quickly understand the business problems and conceptualize analytical solutions that will

address the problem - Get hands on with analytical tools and perform quick demonstrations and customizations

- Participate in the product development process

- Lead institutionalization of solutions by identifying critical use cases

- Build solid relationships within the organization and become the go-to person for analytics

- Lead teams to deliver client projects independently

- Must have experience in Business and Marketing Analytics, Risk Analytics, Credit Policy and

data led strategy in Banking - Should be well versed with SAS and SAS Macros

- Exposure to advanced analytics / managing analytics client stakeholders

- Experience into logistic regression, segmentation, clustering, etc.

- Good written and oral communication - Experience of working in a fast paced environment

- Experience in a technical / client-facing role (preferred)

- Knowledge of analytical toolsets / data systems / statistical modelling (preferred)

- Experience in leading small teams We believe in hiring the best talent and so our remuneration are best in industry. For this position, a

salary band of INR 14-16 Lakhs per year is being considered with exact amount depending on

experience and skill set.

Description:
Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.


Your Role and Responsibilities
You are a Data Analyst, who will be responsible for the management of all aspects of data and information (both structured and unstructured) from business requirements to logical and physical design in an IT solution
An ambitious individual who can work under your own direction towards agreed targets and goals, you have the ability to manage change and to work under stress. You are curious to learn as demonstrated by your up-to-date technical knowledge. You are a good team player and you are familiar with Agile methodologies and principles and/or have experience working in an Agile team. We seek an applicant who will thrive in an open, dynamic, flexible, fun, spirited, collaborative environment; an individual who desires creative freedom and the opportunity to work in a high performing team.

Responsibilities:

As a Data Analyst, you will:
Be responsible for the management of all aspects of data and information (both structured and unstructured) from business requirements to logical and physical design in an IT solution
Have a scope that spans the full information management life-cycle from data acquisition, data cleansing, transformation, classification and storage to presentation, distribution, security, privacy and archiving
Be involved with databases (relational and multidimensional), taxonomies and business intelligence
Craft centralized or distributed systems that both address the user's requirements and perform efficiently and effectively
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data system
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Develop data reconciliation reports to ensure accuracy of ETL Processes and ensure data parity across multiple systems
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities



Required Technical and Professional Expertise
5 years of relevant years of experience in developing complex SQL queries
Ability to debug/ performance tune SQL and maintain multiple Databases including development / testing and Production
Ability to document design changes to databases
Familiarity with daily scrums and comfortable to work closely with leads, scrum master and product owners to provide timely status updates
Ability to prepare & install scripts and code promotion procedure as well as build automation
Exposure to designing Physical Data Models, Logical Modes and Modeling Techniques



Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Experience with Business Intelligence Engagement Model
Knowledge of Design Information System Architecture.
Ability to pick up new areas and work on a Consultant Profile as well

Performs feasibility analysis, scopes projects, and works with the project management team to prioritizes deliverables and negotiate on product functionalities. The Senior BA understands software development processes and is very analytical with problem-solving and conflict resolution skills to help identify, communicate and resolve issues.

Key Duties and Responsibilities
Lead the process design, document and maintain systematic rule repository along with best practices notes.
Define configuration specifications and business analysis requirements.
Create detailed requirements documents and translate into functional specifications.
Performs feasibility analysis, scope projects, and work with project management teams to prioritizes deliverables, and negotiate product functionalities.
Participates in Integration Testing and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing.
Report on common sources of technical issues or questions and make recommendations to the product team.
Own and develop relationship with partners and work with them to optimize and enhance integration.
Educational Qualification & Experience
Required 7-12 years of work experience with a minimum of 5- 8 years as a Business Analyst.
Bachelors Degree required with a preference in Computer Science.
Experience eliciting requirements and testing.
Demonstratable experience analysing data to draw business-relevant conclusions.
Background in data modelling and visualization techniques as well as prototyping tools.
In-depth knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle.
Solid knowledge of agile methodologies like Scrum and Kanban.

Should have worked in projects that involve Data Analysis.
Should have the ability to analyse, model and interpret data.
Should have basic knowledge of Mathematics and Statistics
Knowledge of Power BI, SharePoint, any other Data Analytics tool etc. is an added advantage

Description:
Senior Data Analyst, ED&A ICC
Nike does more than outfit the world's best athletes. We are a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries, and push out the edges of what can be. We're looking for people who can grow, think, dream and create. We thrive in a culture that embraces diversity and rewards imagination. We seek achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Nike, it's about bringing what you have to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
Now, more than ever, Technology needs to respond quickly to turn market disruptions into opportunities for our world-class brand. To achieve this, we must continue to develop our Enterprise Analytics, Data Science & Machine Learning capabilities and team to ensure were maximizing the power of the Nike enterprise in the analytics/machine learning space and managing data as a competitive advantage.
If you’re ready to innovate and be a driving force for building solutions Enterprise Data and Analytics organization, come join us now! You will be part of an organization that is revolutionizing Nike technology platforms and architecting a data and analytics landscape that is simplified, modern, flexible and will ultimately enable Nike on its journey to 2020 and beyond.
Responsibilities:
Build and deploy forecasts and report business key performance indicators (KPIs) for senior leadership and partner with the stakeholders to deliver relevant analysis and insights.
Write, drive, and prioritize thoughtful and detailed functional specifications for real-time operational and performance analytics using opensource streaming technologies
Deploy reporting and analytics within a focused area of the Nike business value stream to enable data driven business decisions that will drive performance and lead to the accomplishment of annual goals
Deploy quantitative research, casual inference and predictive models to understand and optimize drivers of growth and performance
Project manage and deliver large analytics projects with multiple business stakeholders on firm deadlines
Utilize expertise with business partners to collaborate with key partners to understand requirements, drive knowledge into action and support data driven decision making
Document and communicate systems/analytics changes to the business, translating complex functionality into business relevant language
Support and troubleshoot issues (process & system), identify root cause, and proactively recommend sustainable corrective actions
Skills:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, MIS, other quantitative disciplines, or related fields
7+ years of relevant analytical experiences that can translate into defining strategic vision into requirements and working with the best engineers, product managers, and data scientists
Ability to conduct data analysis, develop and test hypothesis and deliver insights with minimal supervision
Experience identifying and define KPI’s and cohorts for apps, traffic, user retention
Exceptional SQL skills
Experience with modern visualization tool stack, such as: Kibana, Tableau, Power BI, d3js
Hands-on experience working with streaming data sources such as Kafka, Kinesis
Experience with open-source, big data and cloud infrastructure such as AWS
Experience writing detailed technical specifications describing requirements for data movement, transformation, storage, quality checks, and access latency
Incredible attention to detail, with structured problem-solving approach
Excellent communications skills (written and verbal)
Experience with clickstream data
Experience with agile development methodologies
Experience with data transformation and BI tools
Experience with retail or ecommerce domains is a plus

RoleData Analyst
Industry TypeRetail, Wholesale
Functional AreaAnalytics & Business Intelligence
Employment TypeFull Time, Permanent
Role CategoryAnalytics & BI
Education:
Education

Collaborate with internal/external stakeholders to manage data logistics including data specifications, transfers, structures, and rules
Provide proficient problem solving and data analysis, derived from programming and marketing/business experience
Access and analyze marketing data, mainly from the customer data mart, but also from a variety of analytic tools (Database, Email, Website, etc.) in order to create these customized reports and dashboards.
Structure large data sets to find usable information
Design, build and automate dashboards per client requirements
Document and articulate the steps taken in an analysis to internal stakeholders
Answer questions about data sets and analyses
Provide quality (QA/QC) analysis and related output
Master all policies and procedures for programming, project documentation, and system management
Take a proactive, independent role in project design, planning execution
Effectively manage time and resources in order to deliver on time / correctly on multiple (5+) concurrent projects
Anticipate project risk and constraints and proactively work on solutions to address the risk/constraints as well as escalate as required
Serve as project manager and delivery lead on analyses of significant scope, complexity.

Description:
Kwalee is a leading independent mobile game developer and publisher based in Leamington Spa the UK’s biggest gaming hub outside Greater London and a great place to live – along with growing teams in Bangalore and Beijing.

Now the largest hypercasual games publisher in the UK, Kwalee is a company known globally thanks to half a billion downloads for hit mobile games including Draw it, Bake it, Shootout 3D, Rocket Sky and many more. These successes have driven rapid growth in recent years and with exciting new projects in the works for Nintendo Switch and PC alongside the studio's hypercasual specialism, Kwalee shows no signs of slowing down!

Founded in 2011 by David Darling CBE, a key architect of the UK games industry who previously co-founded and led Codemasters for many years, our team also includes legends such as Andrew Graham (creator of Micro Machines series) and Jason Falcus (programmer of classics including NBA Jam) alongside a growing and diverse team of mobile gaming experts. Everyone contributes creatively to Kwalee’s success, with all employees eligible to pitch their own game ideas on Creative Wednesdays. Could your idea be the next global hit?

As a Game Analyst you will be thinking of potential improvements to our growing portfolio of games. By predicting the potential gains, as well as Analysing the final results, the role is to ensure our games are in the best state possible for driving revenue. 
You'll be part of a team that will be based in the new office that we're going to open in Bangalore.

What you tell your friends you do
My analysis keeps Kwalee games at the top of the charts for longer!

What you will really be doing
Analyse our plethora of advertising data to identify new metrics and insights to measure and predict performance across our expanding portfolio of games.
Use statistical testing and predictive modelling to recommend and implement changes to marketing strategy.
Manage large amounts of data from a multitude of sources in order to fuel your activities.
Regularly communicate results and identify solutions with marketing, management and data science teams.

How you will be doing this
Youll be part of an agile, multidisciplinary and creative team and work closely with them to coordinate efforts and get the best results.
You’ll think creatively and will be motivated by challenges and constantly striving for the best.
You’ll work with cutting edge technology, if you need software or hardware to get the job done efficiently, you can get it. We even have a robot!

Team
Our talented team is our signature. We have a highly creative atmosphere with around 100 staff where you’ll have the opportunity to contribute daily to important decisions. You’ll work within an extremely experienced, passionate and diverse team, including David Darling and the creator of the Micro Machines video games.

Skills and requirements
Experience analysing complex and varied data in a commercial or academic setting.
A degree in a numerically focussed discipline such as, Maths, Physics, Chemistry, Engineering, Biological Sciences.
Desire to solve new and complex problems every day.
Excellent ability to communicate scientific results to both technical and non-technical team members.

Desirable
Experience with any programmatic analysis tools/languages such as Python, C++, MatLab, R.
Experience with SQL or NoSQL databases for the purposes of data retrieval and management.

We offer
We offer a generous benefits package to all our employees that includes a team profit sharing scheme from day 1 of employment among other perks.

Our philosophy
We firmly believe in creativity and innovation and that a fundamental requirement for a successful and happy company is having the right mix of individuals. With the right people in the right environment anything and everything is possible.

Industry TypeAnimation, Gaming
Functional AreaAnalytics & Business Intelligence
Employment TypeFull Time, Permanent
Role CategoryOther
Education:
Education
UG :B.Sc in Electronics, Maths, Chemistry, Physics, Computers, Statistics

Description:
Roles and Responsibilities

The Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing data across a variety of sources, creating measurable and actionable reports for internal use. When assigned, the Data Analyst will also assist in the creation and testing of data processes. This position is also responsible for building ad-hoc reports and analyses, validating and auditing internal data, as well as monitoring the quality and performance of incoming data sources and platforms. The Data Analyst will work in collaboration with the BI team.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES:

Produce accurate, clear reports as requested by internal customers
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Responsible for tracking and reporting on department initiatives and status reports
Undertake operational research to identify and recommend solutions to challenges.
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Identification and resolution of issues presented by data
KEY COMPETENCIES:

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
A fast learner and able to adopt new data analytical processes
Must have an intuitive grasp for utilizing data to drive business results
Excellent oral and written communication skills with commitment to precision and detail
Positive team player able to thrive in a highly motivated in a fast-paced environment
Responsive and able to manage their time
Customer service mindset

Desired Candidate Profile :

Bachelors degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
Good knowledge of Excel data functions such as LOOKUP, INDEX & MATCH.
Good knowledge with data tools in Excel including Pivot Tables, Remove Duplicates, Filters, and Get Data.
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office
Knowledge of basic SQL an advantage
Knowledge of Microsoft Power BI an advantage
English at a Native Speaker level - must

Description:
Job Description - Data Engineer

Overall Experience: 2 - 4 years
Job Responsibilities
Design, develop, and deploy data solutions for Big Data/BI projects for Pearson Global Product
Design, develop, and deploy data integrations, reporting with cloud based database technologies, and ETL (e.g., Talend for Big Data) processes
Understand and cloud - based data technologies to build out a scalable yet simple and fast Data Ecosystem infrastructure
Design and develop web - based visualizations and other data analysis solutions for data analysts and business users
Develop, maintain, and optimize the Data Ecosystem through the entire data lifecycle, from data modeling to consumer output
Understand, validate, and refine business requirements b y collaborating with product management and business stakeholders
Develop in - depth understanding of underlying data, data structures, and business use cases to ensure data delivery meets business needs for an industry leader in education
Author and modify simple and complex SQL queries for standard and ad - hoc reporting needs
Review and modify queries and database structures using database optimization techniques, indexing, and query optimization for efficient performance of data solutions
Debug, monitor, and troubleshoot data solutions and fix root cause of issues
Develop and execute unit tests for individual modules within data solutions
Collaborate with QA engineers to develop and automate system and data testing
Contribute to an ongoing, system - wide effort to maintain well defined, high quality, predictable data which conforms to Pearson data models and data capture standards
Collaborate with internal application teams to continuously improve the Data Ecosystem
Maintain an accurate and useful Data Dictionary, and promote its use by system stakeholders
Work effectively in a fast - paced, Agile development environment
Mentor junior Data Engineering team members on a daily basis and provide guidance and assistance in members career development


Job Requirements
Education
Ideal candidate must possess at least a 4 - year Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology or equivalent. Relevant prior experience in software development can be demonstrated in the absence of a computer science major.
Experience
Minimum of two years in a Data Engineer role with a background in data technologies/business intelligence/data warehousing and experience in designing and developing data solutions within a large - scale environment

Required Skills Relational DBMSs
Very good knowledge of SQL querying
Rich experience in relational data modeling
Good work experience in writing complex queries and stored procedures
Good knowledge in query performance tuning
Strong skills and work experience with relational database like Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, MySql, etc., and ability to work with multiple sources and formats of data
Ability to carry out monitoring, tuning, and database performance analysis.
Experience in developing logical,physical and conceptual data models.
Dimensional Data Modeling
Good work experience in developing data models and data warehouses
Experience in designing and developing dimensional models for a business process

ETL Engineering
Good knowledge in designing and implementing ETL procedures to intake data from internal and outside sources, as well as ensuring data is verified and quality is checked
Experience in developing ETL solutions for Big Data integrations
Good experience in integrating data from relational data sources (Oracle, MSSQL, MySql)
Hands on experience in integrating data from object - based data sources (MongoDB, Cassandra, DynamoDb)
Experience in integrating data from flat files
Experience in integrating data from JSON structures
Experience in optimizing ETL jobs and workflows
Experience in working with ETL job scheduling tools

Desired Skills
Working knowledge of Big Data / cloud - based / columnar databases (such as Hbase, MongoDB, AWS Redshift, etc.)
Experience in scripting languages like Python, Ruby, Perl, etc.
Experience in ETL tools like SSIS, Talend, Pentaho, etc., is a plus
Experience with version control systems such as Git
Ability to recommend improvements to organisation s standards, methods, and procedures
Ability to participate and encourage continuous improvement within the program and share experiences across programs
Ability to collaborate with Global business stakeholders directly when required to understand requirements and discuss solutions

Description:
The role will be mostly focussed on data analysis.
We want to set-up our systems (RACE, JIRA, AHA, TEMPO, ) so that once set-up we have:
Dashboards: So we can look at the overall picture of the operation. [this will become one of my focus soon]
Exception reports: So we are alerted when the data in a system is un-reliable (e.g. exception report when people are not time collection).
Alerts reports: So we are alerted when things appear to be going wrong (more than 20% time collected is admin ).

The idea is to have someone who can build/ run reports and report on the state of the nation .
Cathie and I would do the chasing (Peter does some of this at present but I doubt a HPEL could do this).

Areas of focus that I can see:
RACE: Ensuring the link OpenHR - RACE works (especially as we are adding new departments). Running regular exception reports and flagging issues (skills not updated, allocations missing, ). Assisting with keeping data current (especially around product list and module lists).
Aha/ Jira: Take over from peter to complete the tracking of Aha to Jira link and ensure that the 1-2-1 relationship AHA Product / Jira project is maintained throughout the year (as products get added or projects get added)
Time collection: Ensure that the exception reports (missing time, missing links) are produced and validate them (they have been known to be wrong). Once the timecolection reports will be in place (still being developed) help flag any alerts related to time usage versus plan.
Assist with weekly/ monthly reporting: Recruitment, Attrition, headcount.
Ensure that HireBridge is accurate: Track against R&D list of open positions.

Description:
ABOUT THIS JOB
We won?t say we can predict the future, but our team of Analysts get pretty close, they turn millions of data points into useful information & insights that help our clients to make better decisions on their marketing mix and achieve superior results. Be part of the future and join in on one of the major transformations in the market research industry with the integration of big data and classic marketing mix analysis.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide delivery and solution capability as a part of our consultant team in driving high quality results on custom project work Ensure effective and timely delivery of project work
Work towards understanding statistical models and deliver business insights and findings Independently able to lead projects to closure
Ensure team?s compliance to AAC modeling practices and company quality standards
Maximize the efficient and effective use of resource by utilizing appropriate processes and tools
To build and maintain effective contacts with other departments to ensure the efficient and effective use of resources
Take accountability and propose initiatives and follow-through
Liaise with appropriate AAC and Nielsen departments to ensure hardware and software requirements are fulfilled
A LITTLE BIT ABOUT YOU
Curiosity drives your interest in what moves the market. You find potential in percentages. Managing time and deadlines comes naturally to you. You?re known for your impeccable organization. Connecting with clients matters to you, and that motivates you to sift through data for a new angle. You can identify the narratives behind numbers, and you?re always looking for what?s next.

2-5 years of relevant experience
M.Sc. / M.A - Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Actuarial Sciences
Or MBA in Marketing / specialized course in Business Analytics
Proactive.
In-depth understanding of Market Research and statistical modeling techniques and applications
Good and working knowledge of any statistical languages like SAS, R SPSS etc
Solid proficiency of decision making and problem resolution skills
Passion for results with a challenger mindset
Capable of mentoring co-workers in order to promote out of the box thinking
Highly proficient in PowerPoint and advanced excel skills
Strong communication skills
Fluency in English

Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
Our Data Integration Analysts work with our Product Management, Content Analysts, Developers, and QA focusing on the build out of Commercial Lines Forms inventory to create more choice for our valued agents with our new Commercial Submissions offering. This is a fast paced, ever changing environment. We continually challenge ourselves to exceed objectives, remove barriers, meet crucial deadlines, and maintain multiple projects, all while pioneering ways for efficiency with a team player attitude. If you have a passion for product quality, love technology, and enjoy thinking outside the box, you re who we are looking for.
Core Requirements and Responsibilities:
Essential job functions included but are not limited to the following:
You will maintain new, maintenance, data entry of forms with day to day coordination between varying team members which may consist of Developers, Content Analyst, Product Management, and Deployment.
You will maintain knowledge of current applications and tool sets
You will use available tools to provide project tracking, documentation, and status.
You will use SAFe Agile methods
You will use available tool sets to perform day to day duties

Description:
Senior Data Analyst Gender Preference Any Number Of Vacancy 1 Industry Area Telcom, ISP Key Skills Data models, database design development, power BI, data analyst , data mining, tableau Qualification As per industry standards Salary (Per Annum) 10.00 LPA Work Experience 8+ years Job Requirement
Key Responsibilities:
Data analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis of the large volumes of financial and operating data that are collected across our business operations. The Data Analyst will understand the fundamentals of the business and then look to improve existing processes and systems, implement those across the organization, and analyze the data being produced to quickly generate insights on performance across the company.
The Data Analyst will be a core member of the VP Strategy s team.
The position responsibilities include:
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize efficiency and quality
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and clean data through automated processes developed by understanding the business fundamentals
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Analyze data from multiple data sets such as multiple business lines, across geographies, customers, price points, product mix and develop automation tools to map the data against budgeted unit economics
Build processes and code base to automate large data set analysis for weekly and monthly review
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Use large data analytics & visualization tools to help more efficiently and accurately interpret the results and garner insights
Position Requirements
Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience of Tableau or Power BI
Expertise in very advanced Excel functions, including programming
Exposure to the Telecom sector or other related industry
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Training in databases, computer programming, query languages
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings

RESPONSIBILITIES
Understand and assist in the development of reporting, analysis and visualization of business data, metrics and measures in order to allow staff to align and track against overall business strategies, goals and objectives, drive innovation, insight and decision making, with primary emphasis on visualization and analysis.

Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Information Systems, Computer Science OR 4-6 years of experience in a related field such as a Business Intelligence Analyst or other comparable field.

Excellent priority and time management skills; Can effectively implement multiple projects.

Job Description
In this role Senior Data Research Analyst, will work on collecting fundamental data from balance sheet, cash flow statement, income statement and footnotes for Global market companies as per the predefined collection policies; and may work on in process audits/ QCs efforts and allied activities too. You will adhere to local teams goals, policies and procedures and work in a focused manner to achieve the overall organization s goals and objectives. You will be responsible for ensuring and improving the performance, productivity and efficiency and the delivery of the operational performance KPIs. You will effectively manage your performance and development in order to support our continuous operational success
Responsibilities :
Establishing and achieving the set SMART goals with the direction of the team lead.
Have a very good understanding of the fundamental data for company s income statement, cash flow statement, balance sheet, and other fundamental data sets.
Participate in the Center of Excellence initiative focused on reducing resource costs, consolidating global data collection platforms, and supporting database integration projects.
Own and Drive continuous improvement within the process through Quality initiatives.
Collecting and analyzing equity fundamentals data for Global market and taking ownership in data quality controls to ensure consistent and high-quality data are manufactured in order to meet product requirements.
Manage data as per client-specific requirement, while at the same time adhering to Morningstar's set KPIs and KRAs. Develop a thorough understanding of the various filing nomenclature of countries under coverage.
Passion for data and its impact on decision making. Closely work with quality assurance and technical department to resolve clients data issues timely and effectively.
Actively discover and raise issues in work (including system, process, and collection methodology) and propose enhancement suggestion to further improve system functionality, process efficiency and data quality.
Participate in other data and process related projects, like industry/market data collection methodology research, market expansion, process certification, new product development support, etc.
Requirements :
Bachelor s degree in economics/ finance/ business with minimum 60% in final year, Master s degree would be an added advantage.
3+ years experience in the financial domain related to equity data.
Strong commerce/finance/accounting fundamentals.
Knowledge of IFRS GAAP would be an added advantage.
Any knowledge on Stock Options & Warrants, Equity Cap Structure Data would be an added advantage
Proficient with the data management policies, procedures and common technical tools.
Ability to exercise control over the executed tasks with the planned activities.
Strong analytical and communication skills.
Should be able to understand the concepts and present teams as needed
Good command in MS Office (excel, PowerPoint etc.).
Preferred Expertise on MS Office, Excel in particular.
DB and programs, and Automation knowledge is a plus
Excellent communication written as well as verbal & reporting skill
Able to work under tight deadlines and handle pressure during peak seasons.
Flexibility to work in shifts.

High level position
summary:

Maximize the potential of the data by analyzing it, interpreting it, creating data programs around it and owning programs end to end from development, execution and business impact analysis.
Duties and Responsibilities:
KEY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
This role is equivalent to Product manager role in ecommerce industry.
Understand, analyze and synthesize existing various data sources customer digital journey, existing product portfolio data, demographics and risk data etc. to design data programs which will help increase business revenue.
Ideate and conceptualize data programs based on business problem at hand and data sources available.
Leverage data science techniques and web analytics techniques to develop data programs that improves the business sales funnel efficiency.
Proactive and thoughtful approach in bringing more relevant and peripheral data to strengthen the data driven decision making.
Continuous enhancement to customer records, data science models and data programs to ensure the better performance of business sales funnel.
Metricize and draw roadmap of the data programs implemented and own the complete implementation of it including data science models, program orchestration, tool stack, automation and business KPIs.
KEY METRICS
Business KPIs
Business Funnel Efficiency
Required Qualifications and Experience:
EXPERIENCE
5+ years of experience in handling data products or data program management. Ecommerce & BFSI experience is a big plus.
B.E./BTech in computer science, IT or equivalent. MBA from tier 1 college preferred.
Proficient in building actionable insights from large amount of structured and unstructured data using data science or business intelligence techniques.
Strong hands on experience in MS SQL server, query writing and anala large data sets.
Hands on experience of R, Python is preferred. Strong understanding of data science algorithms like regression, random forest, gradient boost, clustering, PCA etc.
Experience in model development & deployment is a plus.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and metrics to justify requirements, features and drive management of product.
Ability to work effectively & independently in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.
Ability to engage with cross-functional teams for implementation of project and program requirements.
APTITUDE
Strong individual contributor
Strong project management skills and innovative approach to problem solving and finding solutions
Excellent communicator (written and verbal, formal and informal)
Flexible and proactive/self-motivated working style with strong personal ownership of problem resolution

Network and collaborate with several internal business units to define and deliver joint solutions.
Actively engage in the broader analytics community and act as a conduit to new ideas and innovations for the organization.
Have access to growth opportunities that come with being actively engaged in the creation of a new analytics function within the organization.
Have the unique opportunity to create solutions intended to impact the world's challenges around water safety and scarcity.
Partner with customers and leading digital companies to leverage cutting edge technology (machine learning, streaming analytics, and real big data) to creatively solve problems and disrupt existing business models.

In this role, we are looking for:
A problem-solving mindset with the ability to understand business challenges and how to apply your analytics expertise to solve them.
The unique person who can present complex mathematical solutions in a simple manner that most will understand, using data visualization techniques to tell a story with data.
An individual excited by innovation and new technology and eager to finds ways to employ these innovations in practice.
A team mentality, empowered by the ability to work with a diverse set of individuals.

The Business Data Analyst role is a creative problem solver who utilizes data analysis and visualization principles and modeling skills to uncover and present insights that will significantly and meaningfully impact business decisions and actions. She/he applies data analysis expertise in identifying, defining and executing state-of-art techniques for academic opportunities and business objectives in collaboration with other Analytics team members.

Strong written and verbal communications skills, as well as presentation skills

Description:
Principal Data Analyst

We are looking for an experienced Principal Data Analyst to lead the development and use of data within our systems. The Data Lead/Manager will oversee the team that develops and maintains the highest levels of data competency, accuracy standards and reporting capacity across our PinPoint software platform and systems.
A great data lead/manager can fully grasp the complexity of data management. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of databases, data analysis procedures and cloud-based systems. You will be tech-savvy and possess excellent communication and troubleshooting skills. You will be communicating on a frequent basis with teams in India and the UK. 
The data manager/lead will be responsible for developing and delivering our data strategy. You will lead the vision on how data and metrics can support the PinPoint platform long term strategy and enhance our service offering. The data manager/lead champions and promotes best practices in data management for the full term of the data lifecycle. You will work closely with our software delivery teams, the Information Security Manager, Technical Leads and IT Security teams to ensure the strictest standards of protection and data security in all aspects of data management, data access, data quality and reporting are adhered to. You will discover efficient ways to organize, store and analyse data with attention to security and confidentiality. 

Responsibilities:
Manages overall data architecture and manages, develops, prioritises and recommends initiatives to improve and build upon the data architecture to support the business.
Ensures consistency of process and usage, and champions best practices and quality in data management
Oversees data accuracy SOPs [standard operating procedures], processes, goals, audits, assessment and the legitimacy of data.
Management and progression of local development and data teams
Technical programme management of local development and data team activities
Ensures resolution of data conflicts between systems and within the data warehouse.
Works with internal stakeholders, peers and technical leads to develop strategies for leveraging data to create additional client services and add value
Ensures rigorous adherence to ISO27001 policies regarding information management and data security. Works with the software development manager and other technical leads to ensure GDPR compliance, Penetration Tests and other information security processes are adhered to and completed successfully.
Responsible for user experience with data and reporting tools.
Involved in the design, creation and management of Business Intelligence Reporting
Devise and implement efficient and secure procedures for data handling and analysis with attention to all technical aspects
Establish rules and procedures for data sharing and reporting with senior management, external stakeholders etc.
Support others in the daily use of data systems and ensure adherence to legal and company standards
Ensure scalability and performance of the data systems
Monitor and analyse information and data systems and evaluate their performance to discover ways of enhancing them (new technologies, upgrades etc.)
Ensure data and archives are protected from security breaches and data losses
Troubleshoot data-related problems and authorise maintenance or modifications
Applies judgment to analyse complex situations where procedures are still under development.
Regularly interacts with team members both within and outside of your team, as well as clients, participants, and partners in carrying out their work assignments.
Accountable for getting work done through others in your team. Planning work, filling jobs, assigning work, scheduling, coaching, and measuring work of others. Raises performance successes and concerns.
Requires an in-depth application of a specialised body of knowledge and is considered an authority or subject matter expert in your field within the organization. At this level of competency, a team member applies in-depth knowledge to enhance and identify new directions of policies, services and systems.

Requirements:

Proven experience as a data lead/manager
Requires at least eight years of related work experience.
Excellent understanding of data administration and management functions (collection, analysis, distribution etc.)
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
BSc/MSc in computer science, data management or relevant field
Extensive experience managing and analysing data, including a strong understanding of Cloud data integration, data warehouses and data management.
Strong technical programme management skills and/or substantial exposure to project-based work structures.
Skilled proficiency in preparation of reports, presentations, summaries and analysis

Technical Skills:

MS SQL Server 2016 and above
Stored procedures / Table Partitions / Query Optimization /Indexing
Azure
SSRS
Power BI
ETL Processing
Azure Data Factory
Data Bricks
SSIS
FME
Source Control (Azure DevOps / TFS / Git)
Esri Arc GIS / Spatial Data an advantage

roles: Investment Banking - Data resources Group - Analyst
skills:
Key Skills
microsoft officeaccountsfinance
Description:
Divisional Overview:
The global Investment Banking Division (IBD) strives to provide best-in-class advice and execution excellence on complex transactions across mergers and acquisitions and financing (including equity offerings, debt issuances and derivative transactions).
The Data Resources Group (DRG) provides research support to global IBD.

Role Overview:
DRG’s responsibilities broadly involve receiving data requests from IBD analysts and associates and providing the same from proprietary and third party databases. The function includes interpreting the request, understanding the deadline, identifying the database best suited for the job, retrieving the data, reviewing the data for any apparent anomalies and charting or presenting the data in agreed formats.

Job Responsibilities:
- Liaise with IBD deal teams to ensure an exact understanding of requirements and provide concise and focused research via databases
- Ensure deliverables are completed in a timely manner and adhere to quality standards
- Develop and maintain relationships with IBD Analysts and Associates across regions
- In partnership with Compliance and Banking Technology understand and explain copyright and data usage issues as required

Basic Qualifications:
- Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, Economics and / or relevant field
- Minimum 2 months of experience in financial services / related field
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills
- Understanding of Microsoft Office products, tools and utilities for business use

Preferred Qualifications:
• Excellent academic credentials
• Experience with third party databases like Thomson Reuters, Capital IQ and Dealogic
• Interest in financial markets and familiarity with emerging business, economic and market
trends
• Candidate must be proactive, enthusiastic and team oriented
• Ability and dedication to meet strict and aggressive deadlines
• Analytical mindset with an eye for details
Perks and Benefits

Description:
Job Description :

- The individual should be self-motivated, creative and proactive, to work successfully in a fast-paced environment including diverse technologies, lab as well as cloud environments.

- The individual will work closely with developers, project managers, engineers and other stakeholders throughout the organization.

- The individual should have several years of experience developing with Microsoft .NET and NLP technology such as OpenNLP, the Standford NLP library, R Studio (or similar platforms), Python or Neural Networks. Knowledge in the area of text mining is a definite plus.

- Develop and improve the existing data mining and NLP related processes within our Regulatory Data Management platform

- Develop new ways of improving and transforming the regulatory processes Cunesoft customers are facing with the help of data mining and NLP integration

- Interact with product management, project management and development teams to develop additional modules and functions within the Cunesoft Cloud Platform

- Design and create solutions for pre specified modules and functions

- Use existing tools and techniques to develop and test new and existing work

- Define, create and execute automated test cases, i.e. unit tests

- Participate in troubleshooting and triaging of issues with different teams to drive towards root cause identification and resolution

Support production deployment of applications and perform - validation testing- during the off-hours maintenance windows

- Support and fix existing and new identified issues by either customers or internal test teams.

The individual should have several years of experience developing with Microsoft .NET (#.NET technologies. Skills: C#, #ASP.Net, #Java Script, #JQuery, #Entity Framework, #MVC, #LINQ, #Kendo, #Bootstrap, #Web Api, #Windows Azure Cloud, #SQL Server), Machine Learning, AI, NLP technology such as OpenNLP, the Standford NLP library, R Studio (or similar platforms), Python or Neural Networks. Knowledge in the area of text mining / data mining technologies libraries such as scikit learn, pandas, numpy, etc.

Description:
Job Summary: Incumbents of position will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing data pipelines to expand the capabilities and products delivered by our analytics platform. Must be comfortable interfacing and supporting multiple teams and working with product managers, data engineers, data scientists, business analysts, and project managers, at different regional offices across the globe. The ideal candidate has a passion for data, significant experience building production level data pipelines, and enjoys working in a self-directed semi--structured environment. Incumbents of this position will regularly exercise discretionary and substantial decision-making authority
Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Filter, clean, and prepare large data sets for more advanced transformations
Perform statistical analyses, develop new performance metrics, benchmarks, and indices
Develop and document new data models, ERDs, schemas, and data workflows
Validate and quality control produced data sets
Research, interpret, and perform quantitative analysis against transportation data on topics such as urban mobility, land use, growth management, demographic studies, economic development, and housing
Collaborate with project teams to develop new reporting and analysis tools and workflows
Analyze client information needs and business challenges to determine how they may be addressed through the delivery of decision support tools and services
Apply understanding of global and local trends and events to assist with the formulation of hypotheses and interpretation of data
Stay current with technical and industry developments, analytics software/tools, and recognized best practices
Analyzing, profiling, documenting data warehouses
Writing technical documentation and business documents
Build configurable, parametrized, scalable, robust pipelines/ETL workflows
Scraping, data ingestion and data integration from multiple sources and databases, including web APIs, Protobuf feeds, SQL databases
Data exploration with Tableau, PowerBI
End-to-end pipeline QA
Creating Azure cloud infrastructure and services
Deploying applications and libraries to cloud platforms
Feature extraction and generation
Using Python to clean data, extract features, and build models using packages such as scikit-learn, numpy, pandas
Technologies We Use:
Azure Cloud
Data Factory
Synapse Analytics
Databricks
Analysis Services
Azure Functions
Azure DevOps
PowerBI
Oracle
Kafka
Angular
JIRA/Confluence
Minimum Job Requirements:
Bachelor s degree in computer science or equivalent
5+ years of hands-on cloud data engineering experience
Advanced working Python and SQL knowledge
Experience bringing data pipelines into production
Build process supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependencies and workload management
Database design, schema definition, and database optimization
Experience building elastic, scalable APIs
Experience developing in an Agile environment
Familiar with cloud computing, Azure and/or AWS, PaaS, IaaS
Experience developing Python scripts
Experience using BitBucket or other Git tools for version control
Experience with Linux, developing shell scripts and basic system administration functions
Knowledge, skills and abilities:
Strong analytical and problem solving skills, attention to details, critical thinking ability, and creativity.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills used to effectively communicate and clearly present complex information in a manner appropriate to the audience
Prior experience working in the transportation or logistics industries is a plus

Description:
Work Experience: 2-4 years
Location: Delhi NCR/ Bangalore/ Hyderabad (Currently Remote (due to Covid-19))

What if, you had a chance to be a part of something iconic?
At Convosight, we are on a mission - to help community builders become community entrepreneurs.
We are building a first of it's kind community management platform for community builders who are looking to build, grow, engage and monetize their online communities. Launched initially for Facebook Groups, over 4000+ Facebook Group Admins trust Convosight to manage more than 82M members today. Empowering an underserved dimension of passion economy and our category defining work has already earned laurels and recognition from the best in the industry.
And this is just the beginning...
With our eyes set on the future, we are looking for a Data Reporting Analyst to help us create meaningful insights from consumer data extracted from online conversations

Who are we looking for?
We are looking to hire a passionate individual with an analytical mindset to work closely with our brands teams. Doing this, you have the opportunity to delve into millions of rows and make a difference to Fortune 100 companies across the globe.
You have 2-4 years of experience working in the industry. You have worked extensively on generating and reporting insights, preferably for a product startup.
Communication & collaboration skills. Youve good communication skills and can effectively communicate your thoughts, ideas and solutions to relevant stakeholders.
Attention to Detail is your thing: You have an eye for identifying patterns and trends. You can interpret data, analyze results, use statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Data manipulation skills: You have the ability to distill findings/insights from complex data. Experience with SQL will play a huge role here.
You are an Individual Contributor with a sense of Business Acumen and a hunger to make an impact.
Experience in Text/Conversational Analysis will be big plus
Qualification: Bachelor's/Master's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Economics
Experience with Tools: Power Bi or Tableau, Metabase, Google Analytics, Clevertap, Mix Panel

What kind of work will you be doing?
Enable all within the organization to get quality and useful metrics to be able to use for decision making.
Capture data from many platforms such as FB, GA, WA, Websites etc.
Work closely with the technology team to automate the flow of data into consolidated data portals.
Gather data requirements and analytics needs from Brands Team to develop analytics and reports.
Manage data quality and report production ensuring appropriate calculations and statistical techniques are applied.
Carry out ad-hoc analysis on both user and product to provide insights for marketing campaigns and the product.
Creating the required dashboards for the Brands team with the performance improvement related queries.
Track the KPIs, identify the gaps and opportunities.
Formulate different experiments to meet the KPIs
Identify opportunities across clients to apply experimentation

The perks
All the glory. Working at an early stage Saas company - almost too much responsibility.
Be a part of something (really) big. Not just any problem, the ones that are filled with purpose and meaning. This is your chance to be more than a number and make history. And absolutely no boredom.
Accelerate your learning. Working closely with the founding and the Brands team, you'll get to flex a versatile set of muscles, balancing vision, data, and business potential for a product designed to be practical and solve real problems. No matter what skills you bring, you'll have the chance to level up.

The candidate will work in a team of Data Engineers and business analysts to develop deliverables that support data-driven marketing strategies.

Manage and manipulate multiple large data sets, including: defining populations and variables, performing calculations and summarizations, and creating solutions to address client business questions

Strong verbal and communication skills
Comfortable working in team-oriented, deadline driven environment

Description:
Senior Analyst, Data InformaticsWhen everything's connected, how we connect is everything and we'd like to connect with you too! We are looking for you to help us deliver exceptional customer experiences as a

Senior Analyst, Data Informatics.

At TTEC, we help global brands provide a great experience to their customers, build customer loyalty, and grow their business. We were founded on one guiding principle: customer experiences that are simple, inspired, and more human deliver lasting value for everyone. Your role brings that principle to life.

TTEC, a 50,000 employee, global customer experience pioneer, is opening a new information technology and data science center of excellence in Hyderabad where you'll have the opportunity to get in on the groundfloor of this expansion.

As a technologist, we know you're in high demand. And we know it's important you find the right fit for your future. Have ideas you want to contribute? We're listening. Looking for exposure to different clients, different technologies? It's what we do. Want to make an impact on the future? We're innovating every day. Teamwork key? You'll have the opportunity to work on global projects with a knowledge-thirsty, international team. Join our inclusive information technology team and you'll help create meaningful employee experiences that drive memorable customer experiences.

The successful candidate will be an experienced, highly motivated self-starter with the ability to solve data analysis problems. They will have experience using software languages to manipulate large amounts of data. The primary responsibility of this role is to manipulate and analyze large datasets to answer business questions by generating insightful reports and output. The candidate will work in a team of data programmers and business analysts to develop deliverables that support data-driven marketing strategies.



What you'll be doing

Manage and manipulate multiple large data sets, including: defining populations and variables, performing calculations and summarizations, and creating solutions to address client business questions

Prepare complex analytic deliverables, combining multiple programming outputs to create cohesive reports

Acquire a strong understanding of research topics and a thorough knowledge of the data and programming efforts involved

Synthesize business questions, translate from concept to code, in order to produce client deliverables

Help design analytic data set specifications: synthesize business questions, translate from concept to code, in order to produce client deliverables Lead in delivery of analytic projects

Mentor team members

Introduce new methodologies and efficiencies to increase productivity

Contribute to the definition and development of key findings and marketing-oriented conclusions

What you'll need to be successful

Degree in a STEM field, Masters preferred

4+ years of professional experience working with large-scale relational databases, and ability to manipulate/ analyze / maintain relational databases

Proficient in SAS Programming with hands on experience with SAS/BASE, SAS/SQL, SAS/MACROS, SAS/GRAPH, SAS/STAT

In depth knowledge of one or more of the following: Teradata , SQL, R, Python, Unix Scripting

Capability to execute complete analysis process from data extraction / manipulation through QC, report and delivery of data and reports

Ability to create automated process and knowledge on CronTab, Autosys or related tools

Aptitude in Microsoft Excel

Ability to work independently and mentor junior team members

Strong attention to detail

Strong verbal and communication skills

Comfortable working in team-oriented, deadline driven environment

Experience in following areas a plus

Knowledge of AWS, Hadoop ecosystem, Pig Latin or HiveQL

Experience with SAS GRID server, SAS Viya, Oracle, Seibel

Exposure to Tableau, Power BI or other BI tools

Ability to write Pig Latin scripts

Knowledge of statistical concepts

Business, economics, or quantitative methods background

TTEC Values

Description:
Job description
What is IM Data Management team responsible for
The role of the IM Data Management team is to establish ownership and oversight along with a common and centralized view of Investment Management data to support both the functional and Enterprise level.
A Sr. Business Data Analyst within the IM Data Management team will act in a senior level individual contributor role focused on supporting the ongoing maintenance and stewardship of Investment Management owned data as well as projects looking to acquire the data.
The position will require a strong understanding of how data is sourced, organized and managed within Investment Management systems and the Enterprise.
What are the ongoing responsibilities of Sr. Business Data Analyst
Supports function of data maintenance and stewardship of Investment Management owned data, where specific responsibilities include:
Ensures metadata, reference documentation, and data flows are accurate and up to date
Designs and implements process improvements and workflows to improve data quality and assist in the delivery of timely, accurate, and complete data to the business
Monitors data quality controls and release controls for assigned data elements
Ensures assigned data elements are in adherence with enterprise defined data governance standards and best practices
Supports production issue resolution process for Investment Management owned data and systems, where specific responsibilities include:
Sourcing index constituent data from 3rd party data sources followed by validating and normalizing the data for reporting / Analysis
Identifies and reports data quality issues, related to uniqueness, integrity, accuracy, consistency, and completeness in a timely fashion and works to resolve those impacting assigned data elements
Researches data quality issues through detailed analysis, data profiling, and data mining
Collaborates with business and technology partners to manage and resolve identified data quality issues
Supports function of project support for data acquisition or new enhancement requests, where specific responsibilities include:
Acts as the data SME and partners with business SME s to understand and document data requirements, including data quality and data usage needs
Captures metadata that is accurate, complete, consistent, and of use to the business
Participates in testing of data related changes
Transitions data into ongoing maintenance and stewardship oversight function


What ideal qualifications, skills & experience would help someone to be successful?
Bachelor s Degree, preferably in Finance or Management Information Systems or Financial engineering
Higher education or relevant industry certifications like CFA or FRM preferable
6 to 8 years relevant work experience in the Asset Management Industry, in particular working in the front office with exposure to FOF, ETF s, investment, performance and risk data
Data Quality, Data Governance and/or Data Management experience required
Database and SQL (Structured Query Language) experience required
Additional Desirable Qualifications:
Knowledge of Data Management applications
Knowledge of Enterprise data architectures
Knowledge of Business Intelligence, Data integration and Data Mining applications
Knowledge of 3rd party perf risk applications like Factset, POINT, BARRA etc.
Knowledge of investment management data, in particular performance and risk, FOF, ETF s, and external market data
Knowledge of Data Management and Data Governance and technology toolsets supporting these areas, such as in the areas of data modeling, data mining, data cleansing, data integration, etc.
